title: Newly Found Organics in Enceladus’ Plumes
summary: Dramatic plumes, both large and small, spray water ice out from many locations along the famed tiger stripes near the south pole of Saturn’s moon Enceladus in this image released on Feb. 23, 2010. A study published in October 2025 analyzed data from NASA’s Cassini mission and found evidence of previously undetected organic compounds in […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 140 spacecraft on Transporter-15 rideshare
summary: The planned flight comes two days after SpaceX scrubbed a launch attempt on Wednesday amid fueling. Liftoff from pad 4E at Vandenberg Space Force Base is scheduled for 10:44 a.m. PST (1:44 p.m. EST / 1844 UTC).

title: CM25: A historic step forward for Europe’s space technology leadership
summary: The ESA Council at Ministerial Level (CM25) delivered a record-breaking €22.1 billion in commitments from Member States. This is a historic achievement and a clear signal of trust in ESA’s ability to deliver success through expertise and innovation.

title: ESA Commits to Being an Anchor Customer for LEO Cargo Return Services
summary:
During the European Space Agency (ESA) Ministerial Council meeting in Bremen (CM25), Member States agreed to fund two cargo delivery demonstration missions to the International Space Station (ISS). The agency also committed to serving as an anchor customer for the resulting commercial service once the systems have been successfully proven. With the LEO Cargo Return […]
The post ESA Commits to Being an Anchor Customer for LEO Cargo Return Services appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Follow the Galileo launch (L14) campaign
summary: On 17 December, two Galileo satellites will be launched on Ariane 6 from Europe’s Spaceport in French Guiana in the 14th operational launch of the Galileo programme. These satellites will improve the precision, availability and robustness of the Galileo system by adding spares to guarantee the system can always provide a navigation signal for users worldwide. This will be Galileo’s first launch on Ariane 6 and the fifth launch of Europe’s heavy-lift launcher.

title: Europe’s Human and Robotic Exploration hit by budget shortfall
summary:
BREMEN – The European Space Agency’s Human and Robotic Exploration (HRE) program fell short of its budget request at the ministerial, with member nations agreeing to contribute 2.66 billion euros ($3.08 billion), accounting for roughly 70% of the 3.77 billion euro ask. ESA set its overall budget at 22.1 billion euros — a significant increase […]
